job_details.Functieomschrijving:
As a Senior Software Developer at Elanza, you will play a crucial role in enhancing collaborations across the entire healthcare chain. A key aspect of this is system integration. Our application integrates with client and supplier systems, automating a significant portion of manual administrative processes. We connect with planning and HR systems, electronic client records (ECD), systems of external staffing suppliers, and Identity & Access Management (IAM) packages.

   Another way to enhance collaboration is through data-driven insights. Using algorithms, we can automatically identify the most suitable healthcare provider, saving repetitive work and enabling organizations to make better decisions and optimize processes., You will primarily work on the backend of the application. During the initial months, your focus will be on restructuring the architecture and domain model, where events will play a central role. Afterward, the focus will shift to the outer layers of the application, which includes handling complex integrations with new external systems such as planning, HR, and financial tools, as well as enhancing the interface with the internal GraphQL API.

   Development Process

   We follow agile/scrum methodologies in a pragmatic and lightweight manner. We review each other's pull requests and occasionally collaborate in pair-programming sessions. Our build pipelines with unit tests run automatically, allowing us to release multiple times a day through CI/CD.

   Tech Stack

   Our modern stack includes TypeScript for both backend and frontend, along with Node.js, React.js, GraphQL, PostgreSQL, all running on Google Cloud Platform (GCP).

   Personal Development

   We value lifelong learning. While most learning occurs on the job, you can dedicate 10% of your time to side projects focused on innovation and personal growth. Additionally, you'll mentor team members to become better developers.
job_details.full_text:
Senior Software Developer

As a Senior Software Developer at Elanza, you will play a crucial role in enhancing collaborations across the entire healthcare chain. A key aspect of this is system integration. Our application integrates with client and supplier systems, automating a significant portion of manual administrative processes. We connect with planning and HR systems, electronic client records (ECD), systems of external staffing suppliers, and Identity & Access Management (IAM) packages.

   Another way to enhance collaboration is through data-driven insights. Using algorithms, we can automatically identify the most suitable healthcare provider, saving repetitive work and enabling organizations to make better decisions and optimize processes., You will primarily work on the backend of the application. During the initial months, your focus will be on restructuring the architecture and domain model, where events will play a central role. Afterward, the focus will shift to the outer layers of the application, which includes handling complex integrations with new external systems such as planning, HR, and financial tools, as well as enhancing the interface with the internal GraphQL API.

   Development Process

   We follow agile/scrum methodologies in a pragmatic and lightweight manner. We review each other's pull requests and occasionally collaborate in pair-programming sessions. Our build pipelines with unit tests run automatically, allowing us to release multiple times a day through CI/CD.

   Tech Stack

   Our modern stack includes TypeScript for both backend and frontend, along with Node.js, React.js, GraphQL, PostgreSQL, all running on Google Cloud Platform (GCP).

   Personal Development

   We value lifelong learning. While most learning occurs on the job, you can dedicate 10% of your time to side projects focused on innovation and personal growth. Additionally, you'll mentor team members to become better developers.

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses heavily on traditional software development, system integration, and backend architecture within the healthcare domain. While it mentions 'algorithms' for provider identification, it lacks specific details about building or deploying ML/GenAI models, making it not a direct fit for ML or GenAI Engineer roles.

job_tasks.phrase: enhancing collaborations across the entire healthcare chain
job_tasks.justification: This phrase indicates an understanding of the business domain (healthcare) and the goal of improving collaboration within it.

job_tasks.phrase: automating a significant portion of manual administrative processes
job_tasks.justification: This highlights the business objective of improving efficiency through automation.

job_tasks.phrase: enabling organizations to make better decisions and optimize processes
job_tasks.justification: This describes the business impact and goals of the application's features.

job_tasks.phrase: integrates with client and supplier systems
job_tasks.justification: This implies handling data from various external sources, a common aspect of data engineering.

job_tasks.phrase: connect with planning and HR systems, electronic client records (ECD), systems of external staffing suppliers, and Identity & Access Management (IAM) packages
job_tasks.justification: This details the various systems the application needs to connect with, suggesting data integration and pipeline work.

job_tasks.phrase: handling complex integrations with new external systems such as planning, HR, and financial tools
job_tasks.justification: This explicitly mentions dealing with integrations, which often involves data flow and processing.

job_tasks.phrase: Using algorithms, we can automatically identify the most suitable healthcare provider
job_tasks.justification: Mentions the use of algorithms for a specific task (identification), which could involve modeling, though details are scarce.

job_tasks.phrase: Senior Software Developer
job_tasks.justification: The job title itself indicates a focus on software development.

job_tasks.phrase: primarily work on the backend of the application
job_tasks.justification: Specifies the area of software development focus.

job_tasks.phrase: restructuring the architecture and domain model
job_tasks.justification: This is a core software architecture and design task.

job_tasks.phrase: enhancing the interface with the internal GraphQL API
job_tasks.justification: Involves developing and improving application interfaces, a key software development activity.

job_tasks.phrase: review each other's pull requests
job_tasks.justification: Part of the standard software development workflow for code quality.

job_tasks.phrase: pair-programming sessions
job_tasks.justification: A collaborative software development practice.

job_tasks.phrase: build pipelines with unit tests run automatically
job_tasks.justification: Relates to building and maintaining the software development infrastructure.

job_tasks.phrase: release multiple times a day through CI/CD
job_tasks.justification: CI/CD practices are fundamental to modern operations engineering and DevOps, applied here to software releases.

job_tasks.phrase: enhancing collaborations across the entire healthcare chain
job_tasks.justification: Implies working with various stakeholders to improve collaboration.

job_tasks.phrase: collaborate in pair-programming sessions
job_tasks.justification: Directly mentions collaboration as a development practice.

job_tasks.phrase: value lifelong learning
job_tasks.justification: Explicitly states the importance of continuous learning.

job_tasks.phrase: dedicate 10% of your time to side projects focused on innovation and personal growth
job_tasks.justification: Encourages learning and exploration of new ideas.

job_tasks.phrase: automating a significant portion of manual administrative processes
job_tasks.justification: Addresses a problem (manual processes) and proposes a solution (automation).

job_tasks.phrase: identify the most suitable healthcare provider, saving repetitive work
job_tasks.justification: Describes solving a problem (finding providers, repetitive work) with a technical solution.

job_tasks.phrase: restructuring the architecture and domain model
job_tasks.justification: Involves analyzing and improving existing systems, a problem-solving activity.

job_tasks.phrase: pragmatic and lightweight manner
job_tasks.justification: Describes the approach to agile/scrum methodologies, emphasizing pragmatism.

job_tasks.phrase: side projects focused on innovation
job_tasks.justification: Encourages innovative thinking and exploration.

job_tasks.phrase: mentor team members to become better developers
job_tasks.justification: Implies taking ownership of team growth and development.
